section.title: Overview
section.p: This section describes Web SSO deployment in the NCC SM application and the Web SSO Graphical User Interface (GUI).

Web Single Sign On (Web SSO) works as an authorization server providing authentication and authorization protection for client web services. Web SSO supports one way and two way SSL authentication for the MariaDB. However, SSL is not configured by default in MariaDB and unless you specifically configure it, NCC will go with the default one.Â You will have to configure the MariaDB to enable SSL between the client and Web SSO server.
The Web SSO (Keycloak) component delivers two kinds of Red-Hat Packet manager (RPM) packages, one is the Web SSO server and the other one is for deployment.
